name: Wanagiri Hidden Hill Bali
address: Wanagiri, Jalan Raya Munduk, Pancasari, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: If you want photos of yourself in cute positions then come here. You pay IDR 50k per person. Bit they know the best views and how to take good photos and videos. Make sure to have them move the swings for more lively videos of yourself. Be careful though as there is a safety net, but not too large. Very good photos to make your friends or your Follower want to come! Plus the views are wonderful.
review 2: Photo spot in Bali close to the waterfalls and worth the money. They have photographers inside whom you can tip as per your choice to take professional pics from your phone/camera. They have a huge swing with all safety features too
review 3: Amazing place where you can click some amazing photos. The people who take your photos here are so humble and friendly. Worth spending money
review 4: Highly recommended place to visit.. good photo spot at chill weather of highland..
review 5:
Entrance is 100K rupiah
For us the entrance was worth it as the view was just amazing, given the additional art added to make your visit more memorable. All their attractions were insta worthy. The team were really helpful in getting photos and assisting us.
Definitely one thing you must not miss if you visit Bedagul. üôåüôåüôå

name: waterfall bayumala
address: Q465+78G, Jl. Munduk - Wanagiri, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: You need to walk down and pay 2000 for parking. The entrance fee is 50000 per person. Bring a raincoat, as it's expensive to buy from them - they charge tourists 50000 for it. For locals it's 2000üòÇ
review 2:
Our driver suggested we try this waterfall.

It's quite the drive on a tricky road down to the parking.

There is a small shop at the start if you want to stock up on snacks and water/juice.

The walk down to the waterfall is easy enough.

Not too tricky and not slippery. There are hand rails where you need them.

Took us 10 mins down and 15 up for a little rest up the steep stairs.

It is quite the exertion back.

They do have a scooter service for 25k if you are too tired üòÑ

We were able to swim. It wasn't warm like the ocean but it was very cold.

They say the weather changes at  around 1pm.

It's very pretty. Lots of jungle lile vegetation and nice photo opportunities.
review 3: The wonderfull waterfall, even though the road is far and tiring but it will pay off if you ever get there,  the water it's so clear, cold, that will make you want to swiming...
review 4: Very challenging journey to walk in as the stairs are quite high and stiff. It has 3 waterfall in here which you can take a good photo. Not many tourist here.

name: Pondok Kawinaya
address: Jl. Kawinaya Gg. II No.29, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1:
What a great place this is! It felt like home so quickly because of the sweet people that run the place. We are traveling with our daughter of almost 2 years and she loved it here. Ibu Putu had a son and they had great fun together. Chasing after the chickens or petting the cat. The staff was so sweet with her. We had a really good meal there one night and the other night we could order something. We got a ride to a waterfall nearby.
It sounds corny but it's a home away from home, with beautifull views and tranquil environment.
Thank you so much!
review 2:
Beautiful place to come for cool weather, a peaceful, clean environment and warm authentic Balinese hospitality.
Ibu Putu and her team looked after us so well during our stay and went to great lengths to make us feel completely at home, with extra blankets (it gets chilly at night at this altitude), extra towels and providing hot water whenever we needed it.
This is a beautiful way to experience Bali, especially if you plan on visiting the lakes and waterfalls nearby, or you just want a lovely place to relax and get away from city life.
review 3:
Our stay was absolutely fantastic! I can't say enough good things about this beautiful place. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with open arms by the most friendly and accommodating hosts. They went out of their way to make our stay memorable, providing exceptional support and warm hospitality.

One of the highlights of our stay was the amazing food they prepared for us each day. Finding good dining options in the area can be a challenge, but we didn't have to worry at all because their cooking was not only delicious but also gave us a taste of authentic Balinese cuisine. We looked forward to every meal!

The location of the homestay is a true gem. It's strategically situated near some of Bali's most beautiful waterfalls and serene lakes. Exploring these natural wonders was incredibly convenient, and we were able to reach them easily by car or motorbike. The surroundings are simply breathtaking, and being so close to nature made our stay even more unforgettable.

The accommodations were comfortable, clean, and had everything we needed. The hosts' attention to detail and their commitment to ensuring our comfort were truly remarkable. They provided valuable insights on local attractions, making our trip more enjoyable and memorable.

We cannot recommend this homestay enough. It made our Bali experience truly magical, and we‚Äôre grateful for the incredible hospitality and experiences we had here. If you're looking for a welcoming and authentic Balinese experience, don't hesitate to book a stay at this place. You won't be disappointed.

Thank you to the wonderful hosts for making our Bali trip unforgettable. We will be sure to return and, in the meantime, share our amazing experience with others.

5 stars doesn't seem like enough to rate this place; it deserves all the stars in the night sky!
review 4:
Many people come to Bali looking to experience the authentic Bali. Pondok Kawinaya is exactly that: the construction of the accommodation, the design and decoration of the interior as well as the layout of the grounds, the abundance of plants and vegetation and the subtlety of the night lighting. All of these elements make you feel that you are really in the heart of the island.

Add to that, the wonderful warm welcome you receive and the fabulous Balinese meals that Putu and Nyoman make available to you. Both are mines of information about the area, what to see, how to get there and how to organise transport.

One extremely attractive addition to the property is the ‚Äúwarung‚Äù area beside the reception. It‚Äôs a great place to hang out and meet other guests. We stayed two weeks and wish we could have stayed longer.
review 5:
Amazing place full of beauty and peace thanks to owners and staff of Kawinaya‚ò∫Ô∏èThere are a lot of wonderful waterfalls and lakes nearby.
Perfect to rest your soul and mind‚ù§Ô∏è

name: luwak coffee and tea ( BB LUWAK COFFEE)banyumala wanagiri
address: Q474+FP, Wanagiri, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: When you get there you're greeted and taken for a short but beautiful walk through their amazing gardens, an explanation of the plants and what they use in the coffee and teas, then you sit with a great view and get to sample all the different variety of tea and coffee for a very reasonable price. We loved all of them very unique and delicious üòã  we even got to hold a little baby luwak which was amazing! They also have a gift shop where you can purchase bags of your favorite coffees and teas if you prefer. Absolutely fabulous experience and the drive up with the views and cooler air was great too. Highly recommend üëå
review 2: What an incredible surprise, we arrived after going to the nearby waterfall and thought we‚Äôd get a quick coffee. What we didn‚Äôt realise is this coffee shop is so much more than just a quick pit stop. As you arrive, you are greeted and taken on a tour of the gardens where you see the ingredients growing for their teas and coffees and then the view whilst we sat down was out of this world, and then the coffee is up there with some of the best coffee I have ever drank. Will absolutely go again if we have time on this trip üòç
review 3: This place is a small coffee plantation and was such a great experience! For the price of a single cup of coffee they let you try multiple teas and types of coffee including Luwak coffee. You also get a mini tour and the young girl that walks you through is so sweet and knowledgeable. The whole experience was only 15 minutes. We'll definitely be back again!
review 4: Free coffee and tea tour and tasting. Absolutely beautiful atmosphere! Highly recommend!!
review 5: Really warm & nice hospitality by host Desica. Relaxing environment in the garden to have the free coffee testing with a variety of not only coffee but also tea. There's no entrance fees and coffee testing is free.

name: Warung Makan Banyumala
address: Q465+68M, Jl. Raya Wanagiri, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: This the best food Indian can try if visiting to Hidden Hill. Noodle soup and fried rice was very tasty. Also you get to eat vegetarian food. It‚Äôs not expensive at all.
review 2: Great stop place in Wanagiri . Hot noodles in that cold place is a bliss. Friendly owner.
review 3: Delicious food, good price, amazing views and nice staff. Perfect place to rest and eat!
review 4:
Very friendly people and super good local food.
While eating you can enjoy the beautiful view on the lake.
Enak sekali !
review 5: Many thanks to these kind people! They prepared dinner for us in the late hours and it was so delicious!!! It was a wonderful end to our day in North Bali. Thank you Lucie and David üçÄ

name: PONDOK GANESHA BALI
address: Q485+C66, Wanagiri, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
I don't normally do reviews but this place absolutely deserves the best review I could give.

Wonderful rooms with spectacular views and great value. ABSOLUTELY SPOTLESS !!! Helpful and kind hosts who constantly put in extra effort to make out stay more comfortable and a good breakfast too.

We were unsure before we arrived as there weren't many reviews but it's got a lovely vibe, amazing facilities and such a welcoming stay.
review 2: A beautiful quite place, the rooms where nice, well priced and the staff were amazing. Jimmy was the one that looked after us, I'm not sure if he was the owner or not but if he isn't then his boss should be very happy with him.

name: field of hydrangeas
address: Q474+QPH, Wanagiri, Sukasada, Buleleng Regency, Bali, Indonesia

name: Warung Rekreasi D'Puncak Buyan
address: Q454+XWG, Jl. Raya Pancasari, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: I think it is the highest point of Wanagiri Road to have aerial view of Lake Buyan. Very exotic scenery.
review 2: One of the best place to taking a photo w/ siblings or family in Bali. Great view, Low cost. Perfect.
review 3: Fried rice was delicious. Service good. Free wifi was a bonus üëçüèΩ
review 4: Small cafe with limited food selection, location and view are great though
review 5: Amazing View...and Nice Warung to Drinking a Local coffee

name: Waroeng Mandini
address: Jl. Munduk - Wanagiri, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
If you sit at a table on the terrace at the rear, this restaurant has wonderful views over hills and countryside.

The coffee with liquified sugar and banana fritters are superb. Well worth a stop off for refreshments if you‚Äôre passing by.
review 2: Order 2 chicken bakso, 2 local oranges juice for ide 41000. Reasonable price, cozy, have 2 side terrace for valley view and gazebo for lake view. Will come back later to taste another menu üëç
review 3: A clean and neat place to eat with a spectacular view of the lake on one side, and the view of Singaraja city on the other side. I like their fish dish, especially the Mujair Nyat-Nyat (tilapia fish), the fried tilapia is also great because it is served with delicious sambal matah! The owner and staff are also very friendly! Will definitely be back here the next time I'm in the area.
review 4:
Best food I tasty in Bali with local prices and of course be kind and give a good tip!

Plates are served clean with transparent plastic covering the plate.
review 5:
I've been here 2 times. First time was 2 years ago, I had the bakso (meatball soup), it was decent. Recently was back there, and had mujair goreng (deep fried tilapia) and mujair nyat nyat (tilapia with Balinese style herbs). The mujair nyat nyat was great, and the sambal matah that comes with the mujair goreng is really tasty!

You can sit indoor or outdoor, both have great views. Outdoor seating area is facing the lake. Indoor seating area is facing Singaraja city. It's nice to sit outdoor during daytime, and sit indoor during colder evening time. Service is friendly and great! And the price is reasonable. Will be back the next time I go to Bedugul area.

name: Wanagiri Bali Adventure
address: Desa, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: We had an amazing day cycling down the mountains to Lovina Beach. The team is awesome. They look after you, feed you and make sure you are having a good time! The route is challenging at times but you can take your time. Don't hesitate and book :)
review 2:
The trail was a beautiful winding path down to from Wanagiri down to Lovina, through un touristed rice paddies and truly hidden waterfalls.  If you choose this tour, be sure you're up to "single track" riding on steep downhill paved motor bike paths that are about 18" wide.  Our guide Budi was very attentive and wouldn't leave my side, the vehicle Argus drove was very nice with good Air Con.  I give these two guides 5 stars!

However, the outfitter needs to give more attention to their bicycle maintenance.  I know this is Bali, and I empathize and wish them well with their entrepreneurial challenges, but the bicycles were barely in good enough condition to ride,  When we arrived, our guide was repairing one of them, and finally gave up and drove away to get a substitute.  I rode the bike in best condition, but it was slightly too big for me.  One of the helmets they offered had a broken strap, and the other two were too large.  They made sure the bike brakes did work OK, which of course was the main thing.

It's a fun adventure for a confident cyclist, it's a bit scary for a novice like me.
review 3:
We had a fantastic day out with Edi and Ardi at the Twin lakes (Buyan and Tamblingan). They took care of us, made sure we has food, coffee, tea, water and sufficient rest. They were friendly and hospitable.

Fantastic views of the twin lakes. The campsite near Pura Ulu Danu Tamblingan was a quiet and peaceful location. Ideal to pitch a tent and enjoy the serenity. Next we headed to the Banyumala waterfall and we ended the day with a home cooked meal at a local home. Overall a tiring day but the sights were worth it.
review 4:
My experience with this guided tour was absolutely breathtaking. We were picked up from our hotel in downtown Ubud right on time and escorted to the meeting point with our guide to begin our trek through the forest towards the Twin Lakes. Throughout the entire journey, we chatted, laughed, and had a wonderfully instructive and enjoyable time. Using a canoe, we reached Ulun Danu Tamblingan Temple and later visited the Banyumala Waterfalls.

Unfortunately, we encountered a torrential downpour, but the team promptly provided us with ponchos and assisted us along the way. At the end of the day, we had a family-style lunch and truly felt like a part of their family. The food was exquisite, and they even lit a fire to keep us warm. These people are simply fantastic; they leave an everlasting impression on your heart.
review 5: It is the best place for cycling, for looking's beautiful waterfall, lake and rice field whit natur village and friendly villager üòç, let come for adventure üöµüö¥üö≤!!!

name: Munduk Bali Trekking Adventures
address: Jl. Raya Wanagiri, Munduk, Singaraja, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81151, Indonesia
review 1:
It was a great experience tour to explore the nature. Trekking to the deep untouched jungle and crossing the Tamblingan lake by "Pedau" the traditional dogout cano were incredible. The guide was well experienced in explain about plants and ancient Temples we met in the forest.
The waterfall we visited also really wonderfull.
Highly recommended program!
review 2: I had an exceptional time on the Munduk Jungle Trekking and Waterfalls tour. Great friendly staff and beautiful Balinese scenery.
review 3: Such a beautiful waterfall trekking we ever had on the island,great combination between nature and local culture make the experience more fantastic.Highly recommended!
review 4: Best and recomend trip !! Don't miss it !!

name: Warung Wedang Sari
address: Dusun Asah Panji, Q466+MWQ, Jl. Seririt- Singaraja, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
review 1: It's a good place from perspective of lake view, very authentic. In the same a bit noisy because the road right near. And the prices - 30k for nasi goreng with vegetables is too much from my perspective. Same place ice I pay in Ubud in tourist cafe. Nevertheless a gem if you feel frozen and want to get a cup of hot tea in the clouds. Owner is very welcoming.
review 2:
Got charged 90k for two meatball soups and 2 water bottles. Basically you pay a tourist price at a local restaurant, which I find the worst combination possible. There is no menu where you can check prices so you always got the feeling they are going to overcharge you (as they did).
Really not worth stopping there. Also the bathroom is not good
review 3: 20k chicken balls soup (the only soup they have, i think), free smiles and wonderful scenery on the lake. Like many others around here but less posh and cheaper.
review 4: The best black coffe must try it..  Parking a lots..nice vew at buyan lake and  one the  best area for resting on traditional gazebo Bale from bamboo   ...

name: Warung Ibu Gusti
address: Q466+GF3, Jl. Munduk - Wanagiri, Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali, Indonesia
review 1:
Delicious Tipat cantok and rujak in a simple warung by the simple lady!
You can still enjoy the view of the lake by sitting on the other side of the road.
review 2: The food was delicious and the people was so lovely. It's traditional food and we paid only 38K for 2 people... The view is incredible. We recommand üôèüåû
review 3: 1 bucksho and cracker for 15k . View is very nice ;)

name: Warung Murni
address: Wanagiri, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia
